alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 10:46PM PST until further notice by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 645 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eureka, Arcata, Grizzly Creek Redwoods State Park, Willow Creek, Orick, Fortuna, Rio Dell, Trinidad, Maple Creek, McKinleyville, Carlotta, Westhaven-Moonstone, Scotia, Pepperwood, Bridgeville, Weott, Ferndale, Blue Lake, Kneeland and Freshwater. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
